Key Match Events: Maxime Crépeau made an outstanding save on Di Maria’s one-on-one opportunity.
Stephen Eustáquio's shot was blocked and Argentina broke on the counter.
Canada came close to a shock lead just before halftime with a cross to Eustáquio, but his attempt was parried by Emi Martínez.
Julián Álvarez scored for Argentina in the 49th minute.
Maxime Crépeau made another outrageous stop around the 65th minute as Messi brought down a long ball on the counter-attack.
Lautaro Martínez scored for Argentina in the 88th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Neither manager offered many surprises with their starting XI.
Canada played the same side that drew 0-0 with France in a friendly.
Argentina played arguably their strongest possible side, with Lionel Messi and Ángel Di María flanking Julián Álvarez up front.
Post-Match Reflections: Alphonso Davies expressed disappointment with the result in his post-match interview.
Canada's performance caused genuine frustration for the reigning world champions.
The next step for Canada will be turning strong performances and moral victories into actual results.
Canada needs at least a point against Peru next week to stand a chance of advancing from Group A.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada won 56 per cent of the duels in the first half, winning 73 per cent of their attempted tackles.
Canada had 13 clearances in the first half, ending the first 45 minutes level at seven shots apiece.
Argentina had to adjust tactically with about 20 minutes left to hold onto their lead.
Maxime Crépeau made five saves and a number of perfectly-timed challenges to cause missed shots.
